duties_responsibilities.duty: Collaborate in preparing, administering, and grading examinations for the course.
Assist with strategic planning and assessment of instructional initiatives to ensure program quality.
Implement orientation of new faculty in both theory and clinical facilities for the courses.
Utilize principles of teaching that recognize the characteristics of the adult learner.
Maintain student records of attendance, skills check-off forms, and program data collection.
Supervise student clinical experience in assigned health care facilities and evaluate student performance.
Participate in committee activities that support the mission and function of the nursing program.
Keep current with new technologies and safety regulations.
Provide access to students for ongoing communication through scheduling of office hours, electronic communication, and other appropriate methods.

education_certification.credential: Master of Nursing or higher degree from an accredited college or university including coursework in nursing, education, administration; OB, Pediatrics, or Psychiatry expertise. Valid, active license issued by the State Board of Registered Nursing.
